item.description:
♦ Do you often put others' needs before your own?
♦ Do you find it challenging to assert yourself?
♦ Do you agree to things you don't actually want out of guilt, obligation, or a fear of losing connection?

We usually think of boundaries as putting a wall of separation between us and others.
What if there was a way to set clear boundaries that created more connection rather than less?

♦ Learn why saying “no” is essential to getting what you want.
♦ Learn a win-win negotiation technique to empower both parties.
♦ Discover how staying in integrity with yourself can bring you closer to others.

In this playful, experiential workshop you will practice asking for what you want, staying true to yourself, and finding mutually enjoyable alternative outcomes.

Open to beginners. Wear loose, comfortable clothing. Bring a journal, pen and water bottle.

Finding parking can be tricky in Harvard Square. Plan extra time or take the T.

June 8, 7:30-9:30pm
item.how_to_find_us: Across from 105 Brattle St Historic Longfellow House, on inbound side of circle. (Harvard Sq T) "Friends Room"
item.name: Healthy Boundaries: The Key to Having What You Want!
